metadata.Title: CVE-2018-5710 on Ubuntu 16.04 LTS (xenial) - low.
metadata.Description: An issue was discovered in MIT Kerberos 5 (aka krb5) through 1.16. The pre-defined function "strlen" is getting a "NULL" string as a parameter value in plugins/kdb/ldap/libkdb_ldap/ldap_principal2.c in the Key Distribution Center (KDC), which allows remote authenticated users to cause a denial of service (NULL pointer dereference) via a modified kadmin client.

notes.Note: ccdm94> this CVE was patched as CVE-2018-5729.

criterions.comment: krb5: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needed').
